I will not write you a long letter, but I send these words to you in the hope that they may bring courage and faith to your heart. Christ is all-merciful; and He is your Redeemer. He has not forgotten you. You and your wife may win the crown of life if you will learn the lesson of overcoming by the blood of the Lamb and the word of your testimony. Be of good courage in the Lord.--Letter 44, 1912, pp. 1, 2. (To G. W. Amadon, December 15, 1912.) 

Released May 17, 1972.
